title: 70s sans — estate signage from the Heygate, Elephant and Castle
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802205941im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Risborough_heygate_4595.jpg)

Hello - keen to find out more about this odd bit of sans signage from a soon-to-be-demolished estate in South London…  
Note the curved foot on the 'R' and squished 'g'!

thanks as ever for your time and knowledge!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802205941im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ugh_4043.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ugh.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802205941/http:/typophile.com/files/ugh.jpg) | 16.42 KB |
author: mvor

comments.content:
pretty close to the old 'Rail Alphabet', but not quite… any clues out there…?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802205941im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_12_3803.1985-04.jpg)

Can't name the original unfortunately. But may be playing with [Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802205941/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet) London/New York 1980 might do the trick for you. Overall design looks pretty close and it has also all earmarks you're after: /R slightly curved foot, /r curvy terminal and 'squished' /g.
thanks - -Chalet not bad but still not quite there

For a related 70s font, please check this query also…

[http://typophile.com/node/107720](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802205941/http:/typophile.com/node/107720 "http://typophile.com/node/107720")
